footnotes.english_saheeh: [1996]- i.e., the honor and reputation Allāh had given them as guardians of the Holy Kaʿbah, which allowed them to travel without fear of being harmed.

translations.english_saheeh: For the accustomed security of the Quraysh[1996] -
translations.english_hilali_khan: (It is a great Grace from Allâh) for the protection of the Quraish,
translations.english_rwwad: For the accustomed security of Quraysh,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1997]- i.e., the trading caravans that traveled south in winter and north in summer.

translations.english_saheeh: Their accustomed security [in] the caravan of winter and summer[1997] -
translations.english_hilali_khan: (And with all those Allâh’s Grace and Protections, We cause) the (Quraish) caravans to set forth safe in winter (to the south) and in summer (to the north without any fear),
translations.english_rwwad: secure in their winter and summer journeys.

translations.english_saheeh: Let them worship the Lord of this House,[1998]
translations.english_hilali_khan: So let them worship (Allâh) the Lord of this House (the Ka‘bah in Makkah),
translations.english_rwwad: Let them worship the Lord of this [Sacred] House,

arabic_text: ٱلَّذِيٓ أَطۡعَمَهُم مِّن جُوعٖ وَءَامَنَهُم مِّنۡ خَوۡفِۭ
phonetic: 106.4 Al-Ladhī 'Aţ`amahum Min Jū`in Wa 'Āmanahum Min Khawfin

translations.english_saheeh: Who has fed them, [saving them] from hunger and made them safe, [saving them] from fear.
translations.english_hilali_khan: (He) Who has fed them against hunger, and has made them safe from fear.
translations.english_rwwad: Who fed them against hunger and made them secure against fear.
